segments.source_content: **[Vercel OG Image Generation: Fast, dynamic social card images at the Edge](https://vercel.com/blog/introducing-vercel-og-image-generation-fast-dynamic-social-card-images)**

translations.fr: **[GÃ©nÃ©ration d'images OG par Vercel : des cartes sociales rapides et dynamiques Ã  la pÃ©riphÃ©rie](https://vercel.com/blog/introducing-vercel-og-image-generation-fast-dynamic-social-card-images)**
translations.en: **[Vercel OG Image Generation : Images de cartes sociales rapides et dynamiques Ã  la pÃ©riphÃ©rie](https://vercel.com/blog/introducing-vercel-og-image-generation-fast-dynamic-social-card-images)**

segments.source_content: Vercel presents a new very efficient solution to generate dynamic social cards in Vercel Edge Functions. Practical: it is possible to use JSX, React components (stateless) and Tailwind without additional config. I recommend [this thread](https://twitter.com/shuding_/status/1579607964549513217) explaining how it all works, very interesting! They even use Yoga, the layout engine from React-Native ğŸ¤­

translations.fr: Vercel prÃ©sente une solution trÃ¨s efficace pour gÃ©nÃ©rer des cartes sociales dynamiques dans les Edge Functions de Vercel. Pratique : utilisation possible de JSX, de composants React (sans Ã©tat) et de Tailwind sans configuration supplÃ©mentaire. Je recommande [ce fil](https://twitter.com/shuding_/status/1579607964549513217) expliquant le fonctionnement, trÃ¨s intÃ©ressant ! Ils utilisent mÃªme Yoga, le moteur de layout de React-Native ğŸ¤­
translations.en: Vercel prÃ©sente une solution trÃ¨s efficace pour gÃ©nÃ©rer des cartes sociales dynamiques dans les Edge Functions. Pratique : utilisation possible de JSX, composants React (sans Ã©tat) et Tailwind sans configuration supplÃ©mentaire. Je recommande [ce fil](https://twitter.com/shuding_/status/1579607964549513217) expliquant son fonctionnement, trÃ¨s intÃ©ressant ! Ils utilisent mÃªme Yoga, le moteur de layout de React-Native ğŸ¤­

segments.source_content: **[The future of rendering in React](https://prateeksurana.me/blog/future-of-rendering-in-react/)**

translations.fr: **[L'avenir du rendu dans React](https://prateeksurana.me/blog/future-of-rendering-in-react/)**
translations.en: **[L'avenir du rendu dans React](https://prateeksurana.me/blog/future-of-rendering-in-react/)**

segments.source_content: Well-illustrated article that presents the rendering patterns of React 18 and above. You will find information about how SSR streaming works, Suspense, React lazy, feature flags implementation with Server Components...

translations.fr: Article bien illustrÃ© prÃ©sentant les modÃ¨les de rendu de React 18 et au-delÃ . Vous y trouverez des informations sur le fonctionnement du streaming SSR, Suspense, React lazy, l'implÃ©mentation des feature flags avec les Server Components...
translations.en: Article bien illustrÃ© prÃ©sentant les modÃ¨les de rendu de React 18 et au-delÃ . Vous y trouverez des informations sur le fonctionnement du streaming SSR, Suspense, React lazy, et l'implÃ©mentation des feature flags avec les Server Components...

segments.source_content: **[Overcoming Popular Issues With React Projects](https://dinosaurs-with-jetpacks.com/posts/react-problems)**

translations.fr: **[Surmonter les problÃ¨mes courants des projets React](https://dinosaurs-with-jetpacks.com/posts/react-problems)**
translations.en: **[Surmonter les problÃ¨mes courants dans les projets React](https://dinosaurs-with-jetpacks.com/posts/react-problems)**

segments.source_content: Encourages to decouple our JavaScript apps from the framework (React or other). Promotes a return to more simplicity. Some hot takes that will probably not agree with.

translations.fr: Encourage Ã  dÃ©coupler nos applications JavaScript du framework (React ou autre). PrÃ´ne un retour Ã  plus de simplicitÃ©. Certaines prises de position ne feront pas l'unanimitÃ©.
translations.en: Encourage Ã  dÃ©coupler les applications JavaScript des frameworks (React ou autres). PrÃ´ne un retour Ã  plus de simplicitÃ©. Certaines positions radicales ne feront pas l'unanimitÃ©.

segments.source_content: **[Material UI in Storybook](https://storybook.js.org/blog/material-ui-in-storybook/)**

translations.fr: **[Material UI dans Storybook](https://storybook.js.org/blog/material-ui-in-storybook/)**
translations.en: **[Material UI dans Storybook](https://storybook.js.org/blog/material-ui-in-storybook/)**

segments.source_content: Tutorial with a particularly interesting section that explains how to automate the creation of Storytook controls by reusing the TypeScript types of the underlying UI library. Very useful when forwarding props. Even supports helpers like `Pick` and `Omit`.

translations.fr: Tutoriel avec une section particuliÃ¨rement intÃ©ressante expliquant comment automatiser la crÃ©ation de contrÃ´les Storybook en rÃ©utilisant les types TypeScript de la bibliothÃ¨que UI sous-jacente. TrÃ¨s utile pour le transfert de props. Prend mÃªme en charge les helpers comme `Pick` et `Omit`.
translations.en: Tutoriel avec une section particuliÃ¨rement intÃ©ressante expliquant comment automatiser la crÃ©ation des contrÃ´les Storybook en rÃ©utilisant les types TypeScript de la bibliothÃ¨que UI sous-jacente. TrÃ¨s utile pour le transfert des props. Prend mÃªme en charge les helpers comme `Pick` et `Omit`.

segments.source_content:
- ğŸ‘¤ Sathya Gunasekaran (ex V8) [joins the React core team](https://twitter.com/_gsathya/status/1578816177371250688), most likely to [work on the React-Forget compiler](https://twitter.com/Huxpro/status/1578865666010263552)
- ğŸ‘¥ [Next.js Conf 2022 speakers](https://twitter.com/vercel/status/1578401243243741185)
- ğŸ“– Beta docs: [React.Children](https://twitter.com/dan_abramov/status/1578457525628047360) + [useId](https://twitter.com/dan_abramov/status/1577283961763467265) + [createElement](https://twitter.com/dan_abramov/status/1577463721193897985) + [useImperativeHandle](https://twitter.com/dan_abramov/status/1577717226269966336)
- ğŸ“– [Next.js on Vercel docs improvements](https://twitter.com/leeerob/status/1577788730349436928)
- ğŸŒ¶ [React and Next.js is DEAD â€” Something New is (Finally) Replacing It (For Good)](https://javascript.plainenglish.io/react-and-next-js-is-dead-something-new-is-finally-replacing-it-for-good-c792c48806f6): explains how the Qwik framework presents a superior model to React. Click-bait title, but really interesting article.
- ğŸ“œ [Build a React Custom Renderer - Part 1](https://www.markcodes.dev/posts/build-react-custom-renderer-part-1): new series that shows how to create a React renderer. For now it's quite easy to follow, but it does not yet support updates.
- ğŸ“œ [Remix, React, and State](https://blog.jim-nielsen.com/2022/remix-react-and-state/): gives a mental model for Remix that reconciles the React state in an end-to-end / fullstack way.
- ğŸ“œ [How to write your own state management library](https://judehunter.dev/blog/how-to-write-your-own-state-management-library): useful to understand how a state management library works, and how to implement a selector system.
- ğŸ“œ [How to fetch data in React with performance in mind](https://www.developerway.com/posts/how-to-fetch-data-in-react): explains why data-fetching in React is not as simple as it seems. performance is related to UX/perception. Explain waterfalls, browser request limits...
- ğŸ“œ [Avoid impossible UI states with React, Typescript and xState](https://whereisthemouse.com/avoid-impossible-ui-states-with-react-typescript-and-xstate): TypeScript's discriminated union-types avoid impossible states, and XState avoids impossible state transitions.
- ğŸ“œ [I changed my mind about writing new JavaScript frameworks](https://whitep4nth3r.com/blog/write-a-new-javascript-framework/): there are only 4 frameworks that support both SSG + SSR: Eleventy, Next.js, Gatsby, Redwood.
- ğŸ“œ [How to Use Sandpack for Code Demos](https://www.ctnicholas.dev/articles/how-to-use-sandpack-for-code-demos): article [updated with the latest Sandpack features](https://twitter.com/ctnicholasdev/status/1577683748878884864), this Codesandbox tool to create live code playgrounds. Used by React beta docs, Josh Comeau...
- ğŸ“¦ [Tremor 1.0](https://www.tremor.so/): a library of React UI components to create dashboard analytics.
- ğŸ¦ [W3C Trusted Types + React + XSS](https://twitter.com/sebastienlorber/status/1579485631260286977): a new HTML proposal could provide a native solution to prevent XSS vulnerabilities, and perhaps eventually remove the need for `dangerouslySetInnerHTML`?

segments.source_content: Causal is a Series A Startup (backed by Coatue/Accel) building an all-in-one tool for working with numbers and visualizing data. We're looking for strong React engineers who can solve difficult UX/performance challenges.

segments.source_content: We have several roles open for developers focused on React Native! Pay is ~160k plus 10% bonus. You must have production experience with RN and be based in the US. DM [@gabe_g2i](https://twitter.com/gabe_g2i) to learn more and don't forget to mention This Week in React.

Vous devez avoir une expÃ©rience en production avec RN et Ãªtre basÃ© aux Ã‰tats-Unis. Contactez [@gabe_g2i](https://twitter.com/gabe_g2i) pour en savoir plus et n'oubliez pas de mentionner This Week in React.

Vous devez avoir une expÃ©rience en production avec RN et Ãªtre basÃ© aux Ã‰tats-Unis.
